item.title: People Ask, “How Many Men Did You Kill?”
item.description: A veteran reflects on the difficult question of combat and kill counts. Hear the personal story, context, and the realities of war beyond the battlefield.

media:content.media:title: People Ask, “How Many Men Did You Kill?”
media:content.media:description: A veteran reflects on the difficult question of combat and kill counts. Hear the personal story, context, and the realities of war beyond the battlefield.

item.title: WWII Vet Brad Beeler on German Snipers
item.description: WWII veteran Brad Beeler shares his harrowing experiences with German snipers. From Normandy to Germany, hear firsthand stories of courage and survival on the front lines.

item.title: B-17 Pilot’s Heroic Move in WWII
item.description: A B-17 pilot made a daring decision to ensure his crew’s safety during WWII. Hear the heroic story of courage, quick thinking, and sacrifice in the skies.

item.title: Realizing I Was a Quadruple Amputee
item.description: A powerful and emotional moment of realization. Hear the firsthand story of facing life as a quadruple amputee and the resilience it takes to move forward.

item.title: Famed Journalist Remembers the Battle of Ia Drang
item.description: A renowned journalist reflects on the Battle of Ia Drang. Hear firsthand accounts, insights, and memories from one of Vietnam’s pivotal conflicts.

item.title: Rocky Bleier: From Vietnam to Super Bowl Glory
item.description: Rocky Bleier overcame severe Vietnam War injuries to return to football, joining the Steelers and winning four Super Bowls. A story of determination, resilience, and triumph.

item.title: When Eating Pages Became a Choice in Vietnam
item.description: A Vietnam War veteran recalls the extreme hardships soldiers faced, where eating pages became a desperate survival choice. A raw and unforgettable firsthand story.

item.title: Why I Loved the BAR
item.description: A WWII veteran shares why the BAR (Browning Automatic Rifle) was their favorite weapon. Learn about its power, reliability, and impact on combat.

item.title: D-Day: A Day Etched in Memory
item.description: Remembering D-Day, a pivotal moment in WWII. Hear firsthand stories and reflections from those who experienced the bravery, sacrifice, and impact of that historic day.

item.title: The Greatest Lesson from Hal Moore
item.description: Learn the most important lesson taught by Hal Moore. Insights from the legendary leader reveal leadership, courage, and values that endure beyond the battlefield.

item.title: Major Jeff Struecker – Black Hawk Down Vet
item.description: Major Jeff Struecker, former U.S. Army Ranger, shares his experiences from the 1993 Battle of Mogadishu, the real story behind ‘Black Hawk Down.’

item.title: He Pulled Out His Luger and Pointed It at Me
item.description: A tense WWII moment unfolds as a soldier points his Luger at me. Hear the firsthand story of fear, quick thinking, and survival under extreme circumstances.

item.title: The Cigarette That Saved My Life on Omaha Beach
item.description: A WWII veteran shares how a simple cigarette unexpectedly saved his life on Omaha Beach. A gripping firsthand story of survival and luck during D-Day.

item.title: Ex-Marine Shares High-Stakes Vietnam Missions
item.description: An ex-Marine recounts intense, high-stakes missions during the Vietnam War. Hear firsthand stories of courage, strategy, and the realities of combat.

item.title: WWII Vet Ed Shames and Hitler’s Limousine
item.description: WWII veteran Colonel Ed Shames shares the story of driving Hitler’s limousine and the mission to destroy it. A fascinating firsthand account from the 506th PIR, 101st Airborne.

item.title: I Flew 75 WWII Missions Against Japan
item.description: A WWII veteran shares the story of flying 75 combat missions against Japan. Experience the courage, challenges, and sacrifices of aerial warfare firsthand.

item.title: Korean War Vet Survives Typhoon Before War
item.description: Korean War veteran Burley Smith recounts surviving a deadly typhoon en route to battle. A gripping story of courage, luck, and resilience.

item.title: Losing Oxygen at 18,000 Feet in an Aircraft!
item.description: Experience the harrowing moment of losing oxygen at 18,000 feet. See how quick thinking and training made the difference in this high-altitude emergency.

item.title: My Greatest WWII Achievement
item.description: A WWII veteran shares the moment they are most proud of from the war. Hear a heartfelt story of bravery, sacrifice, and lasting impact.

item.title: Why Water Is Vital in Combat
item.description: Discover why water is the most crucial resource in combat. Learn how staying hydrated can mean the difference between survival and danger on the battlefield.
